It is reasonable to argue that the Church should have put knowledge and understanding ahead of its own authority. However, it's also important to consider that the Church viewed its authority as an important factor in maintaining social order and moral values during a time of great upheaval and uncertainty.

Moreover, we should also recognize that the Church was not the only institution that resisted new scientific ideas during that time period. Many individuals, organizations, and governments also opposed certain scientific theories or discoveries that conflicted with their own beliefs or interests.

Overall, it is important to understand the historical context in which these events occurred, but it's also important to focus on moving forward and establishing a positive relationship between religion and science in the present and future.
